sections.title: Further reading

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: This section only contains citations, not prose that would require inline references.
Consistent formatting of citations is essential in a references section to ensure clarity and professionalism.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Citation templates such as Cite book and Cite journal are consistently used, but there are variations in some formatting details like the inclusion of display-authors.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: There is strong adherence to consistent citation formatting, though some minor inconsistencies are present.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: This requirement overlaps with general citation standards but is specifically applicable to this section.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Several articles listed have DOIs and should utilize the DOI template for proper citation formatting.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: All entries with a DOI have the doi template correctly applied.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Complete adherence as all citations with available DOIs properly use the DOI format standard.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: No significant overlap with different guidelines detected.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Entries without freely available full texts do not have URLs, and none are missing where they would be appropriate.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Citations are consistent with the requirement, as none of the sources appear to provide freely available full texts and thus lack URLs.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section meets this requirement by not misleadingly providing URL links where they are not applicable.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: This requirement is specifically relevant to citations but doesn't overlap with the formatting criteria.

sections.meta_notes: The 'Further Reading' section maintains good citation practice with small improvements needed in formatting consistency.
